Your daughter is a Mu. Although not a very good one, she lacks the spark that seperates journeywomen from women who push the faith forward. It is possible she lost her faith.

No Mu alive would have predicted your daughter would be so average as a Mu. Initally her status created attention but her last of faith as well as identification with the common folk cost her dearly. She is well off but ignored.

Your daughter has underachieved as a Mu. She is daily revealed to be less than divinely guided and her assistants often quit after a few months service. She drinks in and out of service. The Mu has lost her luster.
Your daughter has tried her hardest but is content to merely repeat the stories in a memorized pattern. Often her hour long services engage nobody and she has gained cruel nicknames.
The commoners speak of a wicked Mu, who shuns customers and merely seeks to extract properties from the most vile substances. She has lent her craft to a few assassins and lost popular support.
I told you so.
Please give up Muism.
It is a pity.
These pagan beliefs
Now that the native belief has been reinstated as primary, after the cold night of Buddhism, we have a window to reintroduce various customs, advises [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName].
I don't see why.
I don't see why not.
Muism will be first of equals.

Hundreds of years ago, in the era of the Sage-Wangs, Mu shamans were both male and female. On Jeju-do male shamans, the Baksu, still perform rites. On the other hand the profane holiness of the female Mu, a victorious outcast, might lose its sensationality.
Recognize the Baksu.
The men will be stripped of power. Less monks, than nuns..
Ban male priests.
Influenced by the creeds of India, The caste system, promoted by the Silla made escaping slavery impossible. Now nobody wants slavery to end but a glimmer of hope is a glimmer of hope.
Destroy the bone-rank system.
Slavery lets us live good.
Free the slaves.
Intensify rice paddies and permit slaves to buy land.
Until King Jinpyeong of Silla men were free to let their closest friends know their wives intimately. This time honoured practice was banned and wife sharing has been driven underground.
Society consents it.
No way.
Give this right to men and women.

While our shrines have been dynamic for many years, with Mu-dangs and baksus vying to ink their name in history books, the honey moon period is said to be over. There is talk of corruption in the church by male peers.
Curses.
Purge suspected heathens.
Money can cover this up!
Reform the creed.
Our shrines brim with blood and gold, this is the result of hundreds of years of glory. Yet there is talk that women in the church are leading a conspiracy to from a matriarchy.
Curses.
Purge suspected witches.
Money can cover this up!
Reform the church.
There is a trend in the church to pick up Buddhist spouses to cover a wide range believers.
Ban this.
From now on you are all celebate!
Doesn't keep me up at night.
Expansion into pagan lands of the Wu has suprised chroniclers. [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] suggests there may be benefits in incorporating the religion into ours.
Marry the Wu and Mu-dang.
Wuism is a Chinese religion.
It doesn't have anything to offer.
Since Muism has been restored Bulgooksa, the most beautiful temple in Korea, has fallen into ruin.
Found a Mu order of fanatics and grant it as their base.
Let wilderness purify the land.
Reinvite Budhist monks.
Turn it into a giant shrine.
[Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has been clamoring for a holy book to contain all the stories related to the Heavenly trinity. [From.GetSheHeCap] wants to call it the Sinsetchek.
Give your saction.
You'd better not censor any stories.
Could you make me arise from an egg?
There is no need.

The nature of the trinity is straight-forward, although the roles of the three heavenly kings are far from defined. This has been causing agitation and [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] is at wits end convincing priests to not favour one or the other.
Vulgarism shall not be tolerated.
Excuses for factionism.
I need to read how the Confuscians handle this.
I couldn't care less.

Buddhist monks willing to forsake their recarnation to identify with the people have been spewing debuchary in the province. The real problem is they are competing successfully with Mu-dangs for a grassroots audience.
Bring me their heads.
India must be laughing at us.
I couldn't care less.
I will join them.

Rooted in province of ______ in Gangwan, a traditionalist revival has taken place thanks to the invention of the printing press. The main difference between orthodox Muism and this bizarre variety is the central nature of tigers. The founder Kim-Kyoung-Il fed himself to mountain tigers to avoid capture and is being revered as a saint.
Drats.
Include this story in the Sinsetchek.

Shintoism and Sindoism are quite simular in name, although we permit men to a higher degree and are less weird. A religious meeting by practitioners has given the analogy of Mahayana and Theravada buddhism to explain the two.

Shintoism and Sindoism are quite simular in practice. In recent years our Mu-dangs have partnered with monks, inspired by Japanese practices. A religious meeting by practitioners has given the analogy of Mahayana and Theravada buddhism to explain the two.

Shintoism and Sindoism are quite simular in name, although our Mu's don't sleep with Buddhists. A religious meeting by practitioners has given the analogy of Mahayana and Theravada buddhism to explain the two.
Utter trife.
We spring from nature.
Lock up whoever wrote this herecy.
I will purge the Shinto.
The Jeju god of wind Yongdeung has been declared a demon by your Chief Mushis. While you don't often intervene in non-profane matters, this could lead to strife.
Yongdeung is a recognized god.
Ban the storm sender!
I will leave it in your capable hands.

Rouge printing presses are printing the Sinsetchek in the new royal script. The church is complaining that there are some notable translation differences that could hurt the standing of the church, especially with the commoners.
Ban these lewed criminals.
Giving them letters, made them hate their betters.
I think the book is in for a revision.
Choson

Long, long time ago Hwanung, son of Hwanin the Heavenly Emperor decided to guide humanity and next to Sindansu, a sacred tree, created a holy city with 3000 of his followers. A bear and tiger climbed up and begged to be turned into humans, Hwanung agreed on condition. They would live in a cave together for a hundred days eating only garlic and mugwort.
The old days were less violent.
We need more holy trees!
T

hey lived like this for two months, until the tiger got fed up and went to catch a rabbit. The bear however, persevered and on the last day transformed into a woman. She walked outside bare and saw a hunter had killed a tiger. She wrapped herself in the fur and after a few days realized she wanted more. She prayed under Sindansu for a child and Hwanung kindly transformed into a human for one night and day. Her child was called Dangun who founded Choson, the first Korean kingdom.
Bearable.
That's why bears are trainable.
Dangun ruled for 1500 years.
The Magic Drum

Long time ago a people came from the West who called our region woodland. They arrived in boats and presented cloth that stunned our peoples, each chieftan scoured nature for things to give. Pearls were caught, Jade mined and furs trapped because they had no value to other ancestors, but were wanted. The newcomers decided to live here and their capital was called Lelang.
Curse those Mongolians!
They must have been the Khitians!
Cloth being silk, it was the Han.
T

his is still remembered by us Mu-dangs because the Lelang were wicked people. They brought customs to our country and taught people to cut down trees to turn into paper. We warned them about cutting down trees but they didn't listen.
What did they ever do for us!
I will never forgive them.
The building your sitting in used wood.
Good thing too..
O

ne day the Mountain spirits called King Muhyul of the Gogoreyo to end nature's suffering. Lelang was heavily fortified and worse it was impossible to suprise Lelang because of a magical drum that warned them of the invader.  King Muhyul sent his son into Lelang to convince the Princess of Lelang to destroy the drum. Prince Hodang pledged it would be done.
Go on.
A

fter weeks and weeks of seducing the princess he finally convinced her to tear apart the drum or he would leave. This she meekly did and Hodang sent a falcon messenger to his father requesting an invasion. Gogoreyo caught the Lelangese by suprise, but not before they caught up to the Princess and executed her as a traitor. Following the annexation the Prince met with his father, who seeing his son's viper instinct, overlooked him as Crown Prince. Years later, Hodang rode out to weep on the Princess's grave.
They deserved it.
Nobody likes a traitorous rat.
The result justify the means.
As worthy as the customs of the Land of Morning Calm they are a bit, boring, that is why [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] suggested a revival of traditional dances.
Sounds good.
The peninsulan style, the best style.
The tribal fire dance, backed by a nongak band is the ceremony of choice. [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] informs you, as according to custom, all men are naked waist down.
I'm not worried.
The ceremony is cancelled.
We should wear masks.
women shall not be present.

You arrive to the sacred grove and feel chilly as you wait for a fire to build. You talk about the weather being suprisingly chilly as the setting sun permits you to look elsewhere. In a flash the fire starts and everyone can't help notice [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] has the tiniest wang ever thought possible.
Watch out for the caterpillar!
Jump over the fire.
Wave at womenfolk.
Stoticly perform the ceremony.

You arrive to the sacred grove and meet the notables from the court, the nongak band trailing. You wait for them to light the fire in dread and let out a breath of relief to find out your normality. You read the sacred rites and the farmers band strike up a melody as you dance around the fire.
Not as bad as you thought.
Jump over the fire.
Wave at womenfolk.
Compliment your bodyguard.
You arrive by horse and change into your costumes by the sacred grandfather statue. You suddenly notice you are far smaller than any of your companions. You make a choking sound and made an excuse.
Oh no the unsigned fishing boat permits!
My ancestors are watching!
Why did nobody tell me women will be present!?
My horse is ill!

You arrive to the sacred grove and change into traditional islander costume. You share some rasberry wine and as the rest arrive, you are happy you exercised before the ceremony as you join the other men dancing around the fire. The Nongak band pounds drums and shout broken chants as the fire crackles. You feel a spiritual connection to your ancestors who danced the nights away.
I can do anything.
My ancestors are watching!
Jump over the fire.

You remind yourself that this garb was commonplace a hundred years ago as you embrace your half nakedness. You stand, what else? You talk over security with [Root.job_spymaster.GetFirstName] as various tribes arrive. The Nongak band is late so the fire is made first. You throw a ceremonial woodern egg into the blaze, then notice that all the women are peering at [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] who has a tremendious blessing.
Let other men make fun of him.
I'll bring you along to moor my boat.
Oh no! Marshal my horse is escaping, loop it up.
Marshal would you mind fanning the flames a little?

You intend to perform the ceremony to appease your ancestors. You are so in thought that you don't even notice your companions stripping and you join them. Your new costume is half as useful, but allot more faithful as you warm your eggs by the fire. The Nongak band gawk but then begin a tune as various clans join you: men, women, young and old. You order your [Root.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] to give a speech. He addresses the crowd and you notice the women are having problems keeping their eyes up there. He is grand.
Thank you, I'm sure you reached us all.
My holy eggs are greater.
You can't upseat a ruler like that Chancellor.
Guards! A snake!

You gather at in the courtyard at sunset for the crane dance. The children initally are captivated by the dancers immaculately disguised as cranes. You settle into the two hour Hangmu and realize this is the most bored you've ever been, you pray for anything to happen.
Whisper to your spouse.
Take a nap.
Plot demense improvements.
Guards! A Snake.

You gather at in the courtyard at mid-day for the lion dance. A troupe of men in black masks, presumably representing the sun cursed lands, dance around two grumpy lions who perform a version of the Tang court ceremony. Some Hwarangdul are invited to join in and cower by the lions, who knock their antlers off their head. You join in the laughs as they skip around scaring children.
I know entertainment.
If you cower, your grounded.
These black men come from the Southern Islands.
These black men come from Apurikayay.
The Death of Wangbi U

Wang Sindae of Gogoreyo had three rebellious sons who always fought over everything: Balgi, Gogukcheon and Sansang. Tortured how to divide the land, he gave each son a third of his land and on passing Gogukcheon moved fast and defeated his brothers for the throne. Wang Gogukcheon married Seyeon, from now refered to as, Wangbi Jenabu U.
Ye.
This is why I choose.
A

fter Gogukcheon died, remarkably Balgi also died the year next leaving Sansang with their possessions. Sansang took his brother's young wife as his own, determined to produce the male heir Gogukheon couldn't.
This is your purpose in life.
How can a brother, kill a brother?.
Scandalous.
S

tubborn to a fault he tried and tried until he reached sixty-eight and his hair fell out. Fortunately for Gogoreyo, he took a concubine that same year and died with a son. At the respectful age of seventy, Wangbi Jenabu U was also on her deathbed. She was so afraid of meeting her first husband, Wang Gogukcheon in the afterlife that she asked the people to bury her next to Wang Sasang. After her passing away a Mu fell into trance and said she had a vision of Wang Gogukcheon.
And?
What did she do? Hmmm ...
Concubines never let you down!
T

he deceased Wang said, Yesterday, when seeing Lady U go to that slimy Wang Sansang, I was not able to contain my anger and so we fought ... not to my advantage ... I cannot bare facing my people. Please report to the court to hide my shame with something. So the people of the court covered his grave with rocks and planted seven rows of pine trees between Wang Gogukcheon, Wang Sansang and Wangbi Us tombs. Even death couldn't keep Wang Sindae's brothers from feuding.
May this serve as a lesson to you.
The Story of silk

A Long ago Choson and China were at war. Unless the frontline turned very quickly, the palace would soon be overrun by the enemy. Late one night, under the milky light of the moon, the Wang paced uneasily back and forth in his garden, his brow furrowed and his countenance grave.  The Princess noticed her fathers distress, and she came to him in the garden. Father, she said, What troubles you so deeply and makes you so sad?. He scolded her gently for being awake, for she was his only child, not only beautiful, but highly intelligent. All the people in the state loved and respected her.
Daughters should stay in their place.
Ye?.
He should've offered her as tribute.
Y

ou need not know such things, said the King. To have you worrying about them would only add to my own anxiety. Father, Im no longer a child. I know we are at war. Tell me what troubles you and perhaps I can help.  The Wang was quiet for a while, and then he said, Very well. Perhaps it is better that I tell you myself than for you to hear the court. Since you want to know so much, the war goes very badly for us. Each passing day, thousands of our soldiers are dying on the battlefield, and unless things take a different turn immediately, I see no way to save the state. She smiled, "Oh but there is."
Ye?.
Insubordination at its finest.
O

h? said the Wang. No matter what happens to us, we must save the kingdom, said the Princess. I am willing to offer myself for the good of our people, Father. Tell your generals to make an announcement tomorrow. Tell them I will marry anyone who will cut off the head of the Han commander. I would gladly be the wife of anyone so brave. And imagine what would happen, Father. With their commander dead, the enemy will be demoralized, and we could change the course of this war.  Do you realize what youre saying? asked the Wang. It is noble and selfless of you to offer your hand to the man who kills the enemy general, but the man who marries you would also be successor to my throne!
True.
Smartass.
Stop dreaming girls.
A

fter much pleading he agreed, Perhaps you are right, and your idea might work. Let us try it, my daughter. You are certainly not a child any longer. The next morning, the Wang ordered a general proclamation: the Princess would marry anyone who killed the enemy commander and brought back his head, and this new prince would be heir to the throne.  The ministers objected. It is an unsound plan, Your Majesty, they argued, Leave it to us to select a husband for the Princess. He will be the new king, as you are well aware, and that is a most weighty matter best arrived after a long, hard think. This is my daughters wish, and I am with her, said the Wang. The announcement shall go forth as I have ordered.
And?
Who do these councilors think they are?!
A

s the ministers mumbled among themselves to formulate their reply, the loud neighing of a horse was heard from the palace garden, then thunderous galloping that receded in the distance. It was quite strange, but no one gave it another thought until the next morning. At the crack of dawn, all the people in the palace were awakened by the pounding of the victory drum and the sound of loud cheering. The royalty ran out their bedchambers, still disheveled with sleep, to see what had caused such excitement. Troops gathered outside in the courtyard flushed with victory.  Before he could ask what was going on, the Wang heard the loud neighing of a horse from the direction of the palace gardenthe same sound he had heard the previous evening. The Wang rushed to the garden.
Speak!
T

here stood a white stallion, his sides covered in foam and blood. In his mouth he held the head of the enemys general, and when he saw the Wang, he reared up and dropped the grisly head by the Wang. A soldier rushed forward and knelt.  Your Majesty, he said, Your Majesty, it was most unbelievable! This horse attacked the enemy general and tore off his head. With the leader gone, our enemy was completely demoralized, and the rest of the battle was a rout! As the soldier spoke, the horse nodded its head modestly as if he were attesting to the truth of the report. The Wang embraced the horse, weeping with joy. Oh, brave steed, he said, What a wonderful horse you are to bring us victory with your great valor. From that day, the Wang kept the stallion in its own stable with its personal attendant, and often mounted him.
That was not the deal.
What a noble stallion!
B

ut the Princess was not satisfied. The Wang was secretly relieved that it was a horse, and not a man, that had brought the enemy generals head. Now there was no problem with an unsatisfactory son-in-law or an inappropriate successor to the throne as the ministers had feared. The King no longer considered himself bound by terms, but the Princess was of an entirely different mind, and she said, Father, I consider the horse to be my husband. In order to remain faithful to my word, I will not marry anyone else.  What nonsense are you speaking? said the King. Dont concern yourself with the horse. I am seeing to it that he gets the best treatment of any horse in the kingdom.
Ye?
Yuck.
I'm taking away your ponies.
A perfectly natural response.
T

he Princess begged and begged and the King had enough. He grabbed a sword and went to sacrifice the stallion, despite her plees to forgive her, his anger got the best of him and he slayed the stallion, which made a terrible scream. He ordered his men to skin the horse and hang its hide from a tree in the garden. Each morning, the Princess would come to the garden and spend the entire day there grieving for the horse. One day there was a cry from the garden, the princess had wrapped herself in its skin and a gust of wind blew her far away. The King was full of remorse, and he looked for his lost daughter. He grew ill and took to his bed for a season. In the spring, there came word that a horsehide had been found hanging from a tree in a remote part of the kingdom.
See!
How tragic.
T

The court Mu plucked a worm from the hide and announced a recarnation had occured. She spoke: Upon close examination, Your Majesty, you will see that the mouth of the worm resembles the mouth of a horse. If you look closely, you will see that it nibbles at the leaf very much like a horse chewing on grass. And the smooth skin of this worm resembles the smooth complexion of our late Princess.  The Wang examined the worm eating the leaf of the strange tree, and then he burst into tears again, wailing, Alas! My daughter! Now you have been reborn a worm. The worm was looked after and laid many eggs, distributed to Gangwan and Saro - soon people learned how to produce silk from it by feeding it mulberry tree leaves. It is said that by eating raw silkworms, you may acquire the smooth skin of the Princess. But whether that is fact or fancy, no one can say.
Have some water Grandma.
Will I catch any of you eating worms?
Stranger than fiction.
I was joking you can keep your ponies.

You are in court debating how you can increase your levy with [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] when your daughter steps in. She is with her attendants and asks forgiveness for distrupting an important talk. She gives [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] a look that you've never seen before and hands you a pot of ginseng tea. Her attendants look ill at ease and shield her and she leaves the room.
She will make a fantastic wife.
I need to marry her to a talented man.
What has got into her?
Tell me why she blushes around you!
You are discouraging measures to decrease crime with [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] he suggests banning private armies to carry arms into your demense. It will be simular to the palace law.
I can't get them to agree.
Fantastic idea.
[Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] comes into your room while your daughter is visiting. She looks at him, gives a yelp like a stricken kitten and departs without bowing.
She seems to like you.
A master can take the horse to the water, but can't make it drink.
Still a child I see.
You are supervising [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] train your foces. Somehow you feel your being watched, you peer behind you and see your daughter watching you two with her attendants.
She might want to learn Taekwondo?
This has gone too far.
I hope she doesn't fancy a soldier.
Your daughter wants to visit the temple of Bulgooksa, she suggests [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] can escort her there.
That sounds reasonable
He has better things to do.
I'd prefer our fat cook, he could do with losing weight.

You are discussing horse races with [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] when your daughter's servant comes in. She announces your daughter needs you immediately. You rush there to see your darling sick in bed, you mean to instruct her servant. But she isn't there.
How benal
Could she be making a bet?
I'm going to talk to my marshal.
[Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] has spent two days enduring pain and has not confessed to anything.
He is free.
Keep him in jail.
Torture him further.
[Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] has confessed to having a vague relationship with your daughter. He expects he will be executed.
He is right.
A vague relationship is fine.
What happens in the dark, will come to light. But you'll stay in the dark.
You have it in mind to kill your filthy, lying daughter. As prescribed by Confuscian thought.
Yes.
No.
You confront your daugher who confesses that they developed feelings for each other. You scream and shout but finally come to a decision.
You will be married.
He will be exiled.
Buddha is your husband now.
[Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] has asked for your daughters hand, given that he is a prestigious vassal and will bring glory to our house.
You will be married.
You need more prestige.
Your straightfaced humour always amuses me.

One Day you are talking about your favorite things with your daughter. You bring up the topic of [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] and she says he is a dear friend. It seems that your paranoia was for naught.
Yes, of course.
[Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] has through his blade achieved a respect amongst the people. Maybe it is time to revisit your promise to him.
I'm sorry if it offends him but no.
Yes.
[Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] is happily married and your daughter refused to attend their ceremony. She is currently locked in her room.
What a brat.
Bring her some food.
[Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] has been spending a suspicious about of time with your daughter. You suspect the private arching lessons, involve more than bowing.
I will summon him.
It is probably nothing.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has accused you of indecent behavior with his daughter. You can deny it or confess.
You have this completely wrong Dehah!
I confess.
[Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] denies disgracing you
column3: or your daughter. In fact your daughter has made tremendous progress in archery.

column2: Ah, you deserve a reward.
Guards arrest him!.
My spymaster has already observed you.

The plants are sown, the animals stir, it is time to worship the sky-diety to keep up our chain of good luck. Already the price of Iris roots have skyrocketed as everyone knows this year will be special.
Let it be held.
Joyous preparations begin.
As a woman you join the servants to wash your hair in sweet flag the night before the festival. It feels heavy and sticky but you can't deny how shiny you feel.
Radient.
It's supposed to help hair growth!

Your court takes a trip to the town-exterior to sacrifice to the sky-diety. [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] lays down clay horses on a stone tablet while you and your girls purify yourself in a onchon.

Your court takes a trip to the town-exterior to sacrifice to the sky-diety. [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] lays down clay horses on a stone tablet while you and your trusted men wash in a onchon.
Water wash away my sins.

You return and together pray to the wheel in the sky. [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] invites, one by one, all hundred types of animal who live in your demense to frolic and spread. As the sun is highest in the sky you recieve the sky sword and with one mighty slice cut off a pony's head.

You return and together pray. [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] invites, one by one, all hundred types of animal who live in your demense to frolic and spread. You look up and see the time is for the sacrifice. You call for the sky sword and, after hesitation, fell the screaming pony's head with three slices.
What is precious, is yours.
Afterwards you purify yourself in the onchon once more and give a final bow as you leave. You see the sky set and your spirits rise as you hear singing and dancing in the distance.

Afterwards you purify yourself in the onchon once more. Your chamber-maid is scared to even give you the towel. Before you leave you give a final bow. You see the sky set and you play with your hair in the canopy. You hear singing and dancing in the distance.
May the cycle continue.
You are watching a ssireum match and fancy you could do better than these peasant wrestlers.
You are watching a ssireum match. The two men tustle, both sweaty under the sun, you feel the inclination to join them on the grass.
You are watching two men do ssireum, a Korean past-time where two men wrestle each other until victory, you consider joining the winner.
You are watching a ssireum match. The two men grapple, both sweaty under the sun, you feel the inclination to join them on the grass.
You are watching a ssireum match. You have no idea how men so bulky can move so swiftly. The orthodox switches to the unorthodox as a loser ends up on top. It looks deceiptingly simple.
I have the weight.
You enter the competition.
I have the strength.
You enter the competition.
I have the cunning.
You enter the competition.
The flesh is weak.
You don't enter the competition.

You declare your resolve and the commoners are thrilled to see [From.GetTitledFirstName] pull off his silk and bow to his opponent. You lunge forward but your enemy trips you and quickly wrestles you into surrender.
I give! I give!
You lose.

After removing your chains and silk you square up to your opponent. You circle each other and he tries to sweep you. You grab his leg and mount him, using your portly figure to exhaust his muscles. After a minute he stops struggling and you win.
Stout performance.

Slaves and commoners crowd the field as you prepare to defeat the tired foe. You circle him at a fast pace, taking advantage of his tired corpus. You avoid his grabs and tug free. Finally he tries to sweep you and exhausted falls on one leg. You push him over and grab his leg, twisting him into helplessness.
Success!

You both are muscular but he is more so. This you find out when you lock arms and he sweeps you with his experienced footwork. He seemingly holds you in mid-air as he adjusts a comfortable fall for his social superior. The crowd jeers.
Good sport!
Kill his entire family.
You both are muscular but only one is tired. Your grapling goes your way and his failure to sweep only makes him collapse faster. The crowd jeers at the defeat of the champion.
Good sport!

After handing your jade chain and silk garnements you make your way to the center. You bow and grasp hands, you feel your strength leaving you until a crazed peasant runs in and splashes everyone with Baekju. The event stops.
What a shame I almost won.
You see an old man peddling his wares after one outing. He claims his medical herbs are soaked in the dew of the fifth day, thus extra valuable.
Recommend me some.
You could be an agent.
Tell me a tale of your region.

In Cheonju we all speak tediously slow. A story says a boy was climbing a mountain with his father and a rock started tumbling from the peak. The son jumped away and yelled "watch out!", but he only got to the second syllable before his father was knocked off.
Funny in a morbid way.
No kidding it is dusk already!
Maybe speaking slow could help me
You decide to go on the high swing. Your servants chase away vagrant boys and you are hoisted up.
Push me!
Er ... put me down.

Preparation ...

You stumble home with your bodyguards, they keep their heads down as you twirl and dance.

In your dreams.
Tell him you're taken.
Give him a kiss on the cheek.
You stumble home, occasionally leaning on your bodyguards, the drink alone can't keep at bay the thought that now: Everyone knows you're a crummy dancer.
I am the greatest.

You've mastered the hundred branches of knowledge.
Rarer than dry, polished rice.

Could you bring some choice meat for the barbeque?.
Their faces turn white, then fill with color. "Of course your majesty! We have all kinds." You give a soulful smile and leave.
Cannot wait.

Peace be with you, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. I will be there..
OK
Peace be with you, [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. I am not going to be there, so I must decline.
Sure.

The tables are laid out in [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court yard. You are uncertain about how long the ceremony will go, the food provided is scant. You have left over pitchforks and can't conceil your disgust with your followers.
Well ... Well ....

There is confusion in [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court yard. There has been no food brought and the last minute followers you hoped to bring haven't materialized. You've been forced to call it off.
These unholy times ...

When you arrive to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court yard you see nobody there. You wait five minutes, for surely this must be a test of faith? A servant from the palace comes and informs you it is cancelled, but maybe you want to see the [Root.Liege.GetTitle]?
That sounds best.
I'll survey the festival.
Time to go.
The tables are laid out in [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court yard, the smell of fresh pork, honeyed treats and exotic herbs brings you rightful pleasure.
Thank you.

The tables are laid out in [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court yard, the array of sweets, white cabbage from China, six dolphins from the coast and a boar makes you pleased to open the ceremony. It is clear your dangol thought of your every need
Perfect.

The tables are laid out in [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court yard, the tables laid out groan with finely prepared food, you have had to reject some pieces to your immense regret. You could not ask for better followers as you poke a mutton with your pickfork.
You are worthy.
When you arrive you see the tables are laid out in the royal palace's courtyard, you note that your contributions are one of the scarce offerings to esteemed [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s palate.
Worrying.

You are have been present for the ceremony for some time, against the better advice of your spouse. Although the contributions aren't a feast - those present can rest assured quality surely will beat quality
Perfect.

The tables are laid out in [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s court yard, you are quite jealous of the variety of food so close to your fingers. You must ask [From.GetTitledFirstName] in more profane times for opinions on the dolphin cutlets.
Oh my stomach is a tiger.

You had half the mind to go to [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] when you heard your daisy-cakes had been rejected. But now you see it was only practical as a divine amount of food is on display. It is good that the gates are barred shut so the peasants and slaves need not lose sleep!
All yours!.

After some quiet commodition you clear your salavating throat and your fellow vassals are quiet. "Me and my possessing deities greet you. We will greatly enjoy the range of food present. While we sample a few bites please feel free to remind me of my outer-worldly ...
powers.

When you hear [From.GetTitledFirstName]'s toad like grunt every follower is quiet. "Me and my possessing deities greet you. We will greatly enjoy the range of food present. While I sample a few bites please feel free to remind me of my outer-worldly powers."
Praise one of their heavenly traits.
Invent a tall tale!
Beg Son to not visit!
Subvert the ceremony
[From.GetTitledFirstName] steps forward and reminds the audience of your chaste nature. [From.GetSheHe] says it must be assuring to your deities that you are married to the faith foremost.
Thank you.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] steps forward and reminds the audience of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s chaste nature. [From.GetSheHe] says it must be assuring to the deities that [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is married to the faith foremost.
Hear!
Make no commment

[From.GetTitledFirstName] raises their hands and in an enthralled voice praises your temperate values. [From.GetSheHe] lists in detail all the food present and how you've not had a bite from respect to the dieties. [From.GetSheHe] also suggests this is not natural, that you feed off divine energies.
Thank you.
Take a bite.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] raises their hands and in an enthralled voice praises [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s restraint surrounding food. "Note", [From.GetSheHe] exclaims "[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has not touched a duck wing or spooned some turtle soup.
Hear!
Make no commment

[From.GetTitledFirstName] bumps ahead and drones out all the instances, real or imagined of charity you've bestowed. At some point you marvel at what a generous person you are and feel appreciated for your core values.
Thank you.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] bumps into you and without erring drones out [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s charitable endeavours. They reach quite a dear sum!.
Heavens smile on you
Make no commment

[From.GetTitledFirstName] loudly shouts about your work ethic. You at first believe this speech is hostile until you realize they attribute this to your relationship with the gods. [From.GetSheHe] recounts when you translated Han text for three days straight without knowing the characters.
Thank you.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] shouts near your eyes about how [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] can translate Chinese texts without knowing a single character. You are left wondering if this is due to the gods or simply extends to [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s extreme humble nature.
Extraordinary.
Make no commment

You are getting tired from standing when [From.GetTitledFirstName] reminds the congregation how your patience rivals the black turtle. Although it is not the story you wanted, you do agree with the crowd you are extraordinary patient, due to listening to the god's council.
I thank the gods.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] tells us about the many instances [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was patient with society. [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s daily cultivation has created a person who patiently listens and leaves each and everyone with a postitive feeling.
Gift from the gods.
Make no commment

[From.GetTitledFirstName] remarks that you have been chosen to be the epitome of kindness. You are suprised that while many accredit god with your boundless deeds, you too are marked out for making everyone around you happier.
If you say so.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] remarks of [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s kind nature. [FromFrom.GetHisHer] considerate and warm nature would drive Buddha to envy!
Yes.
Make no commment
[From.GetTitledFirstName] mentions how you have never bragged. People feel relaxed knowing that you are comfortable with your station and because it is a lofty one, no one is more suitable.
If you say so.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] mentions how [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] is the last person anyone could consider prideful. Selfless, trustworthy, like a hound and sacrificing are just some words used to describe [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName].
It's true!
Make no commment
There is commotion as [From.GetTitledFirstName] drops to their knees. "Son, please spare me, my family and my tribe. If you can't kill me now!". [From.GetHisHer] wails are horrible.
Ensure there is no worries
Sonnimne deserves gold.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] mentions how when lost in the forest you walked up to a bear's mother and adopted her cub. This cub was trained in dancing but not shown to [liege.GetTitleFirstName] because it could be used as tribute. It eventually accended to heaven after a rainstorm with your blessings.
If you say so.
Are you mocking me?

[From.GetTitledFirstName] mentions how when [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] was deep in the thicket [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] stole a cub from a she-bear. [FromFrom.GetSheHe] recognized the bear's talents and kept it close to heart, this is why very little people know this.
It's true!
Make no commment
[From.GetTitledFirstName] retells that your prior self was Silla hero Kim Yusin and this explains your familiarity with the Hwarang and how to advance in society like a whirlwind.
If you say so.
Are you mocking me?
[From.GetTitledFirstName] retells [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s first incarnation was none other than Kim Yusin and this explains their ease in social climbing.
It's true!
Make no commment

[From.GetTitledFirstName] postulates that since your ascension to the post of Court Mu the [Root.GetTemperature] weather of the country has been remarkably mild. This has been due to your hybrid use of astronomy and divination.
If you say so.
Are you mocking me?

[From.GetTitledFirstName] postulates that [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s finest example of supernatural power is mastery over the elments. [From.GetSheHe] recalls various months that in the past bellied disaster, but [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] eased thanks to divine favour.
It's true!
Make no commment

[From.GetTitledFirstName] mentions that your productivity in the bedroom has refilled the land plauged by war. "If anyone can consider themselves a loyalist to a cause, it is [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]."
If you say so.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] mentions how [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s frolicing in silk sheets with the best part of the population has served the country.  "If anyone can consider themselves a loyalist to a cause, it is [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]."
It's true!
Make no commment
[From.GetTitledFirstName] compares you the fat budda and suggests crude religious reasons for your love of food.
I was not a pig!
I guess I'll not eat, then?

[From.GetTitledFirstName] talks about the wheel of buddhism and [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s place on it. [From.GetSheHe] considers that because the Court Mu loves large helpings of rice they might have been a cow, but because [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] eats meat they could've been a wild dog.
If you say so.
Make no commment

You wait for an appraisal and [From.GetTitledFirstName] mentions how much wealth you've raised. [From.GetSheHe] gives poetic descriptions of the various storehouses you've built to keep the cash secure.
This is true ...
I plan to give it all away

[From.GetTitledFirstName] reveals how much wealth [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] has hidden like Teojusin from the masses. [From.GetSheHe] helps you understand [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s wealth "Imagine this table, piled with jade".
Oh really?
Make no commment

Your Dangol [From.GetTitledFirstName] emphasizes how you seclude yourself from the people for days on end. "Some wonder if you neglect your duties, but I always answer - [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName] does this to be pure.".
This is true ...
[From.GetTitledFirstName] satirizes [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s lack of work ethic. This may or may not have been understood as the Court Mu doesn't seem engaged.
Quite So.
Make no commment
[From.GetTitledFirstName] dares not to comment in detail, as to not raise your legendary temper.
Hmp.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] in an exagerated manner refuses to evaluate [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s character as they have a legendasry temper.
Quite So.
Make no commment
The most peaceful [From.GetTitledFirstName] stresses how you have coped with being the least consulted minister of the court, having limited power in the governance of the nation.
Enough.

The most peaceful [From.GetTitledFirstName] subtly makes fun of the Court Mu's status compared to the mightier subjects of the Wang. You can see [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s face redden at the realization.
Quite So.
Make no commment
You can not but bite your tongue at [From.GetTitledFirstName] making game of your proud linage. Relying on my ancestors was not how you achieved your spiritual greatness!
Arg!
The high [From.GetTitledFirstName] mentions [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s proud linage drawing laughs from the crowd at some side remarks. "He may have come from an egg, abit not a golden one."
Quite So.
Make no commment
You mill around some thoughts about [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], however without specific examples they don't seem very impressive.
What a good person.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] mentions some specifics but generally can't find much to say on the spot.
Fair enough.

The ceremony has been a long one. Because of all the compliments you extend the ceremony for another day, reciting tales through the night. Your fellow shamans pay tribute to your piety as a spiritual leader.
Thank you.
The ceremony has finished, you are ready to enjoy the rest of Dano.
Quite so.
I haven't though!
The Hwarengi, famous throughout the Gyeonggi province, are male priests with artistic inclining. Their leader, clad in a grandmother mask, asks for donations in order to publish their poetry faster.
No, get lost.
I can give you this sum.
During the ceremonial curse to [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]'s, [From.GetTitledFirstName] burns his mask and shows his displeasure publicly.
Poets become critical.
It turns out the leader, who spoke in a voice most unnatural, was [From.GetTitledFirstName] he has urged your subjects to raly around their [FromFrom.GetTitle].
Poets become critical.
It has been many years since the Hwarengi, not to be mistaken with the Hwarang, recieved funding. They have, since, wrote a rather nice book of "original" poetry: the Dodang Volume.
Curious.
It has been many years since the Hwarengi, not to be mistaken with the Hwarang, were given royal grants. They've spent this time throwing a sequence of cultural parties
Arrest [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName].
Let this pass.
It has been many years since the Hwarengi, not to be mistaken with the Hwarang, were given gifts of jade. They have built a curious manufactory where they stamp paper with ink.
Oh, interesting.
Promote this invention.
It has been many years since the Hwarengi, not to be mistaken with the Hwarang, were given gifts of jade. They have built a curious manufactory where they stamp paper with ink.
Oh, interesting.
Promote this invention.
In the coastal town of [fishingvillage.GetName], during the fifth moon locals pray for peace, safety and a big catch!
Pay a suprise visit.
Attend a Big Catch festival.
column4: Eure Bediensteten gehen, um den Eunuchen zu holen.
column6: Tus sirvientes van a buscar al eunuco.

column2: Would rather do something else.
Spend the day as planned.
column4: Eure Bediensteten gehen, um den Eunuchen zu holen.
column6: Tus sirvientes van a buscar al eunuco.

column2: It was an uneventful journey until, with a jolt, your royal guard cries out "pirates". All over [fishingvillage.GetName]!
Send your men to fight!
Join your men in the fight!
Flee.
In the fray you men have captured one pirate who keeps base in the Isles of the East Sea.
Execute him on the spot.
Welcome to my ship.
The pirates rush to their boats and flee. After finding the cowering local hojo, it seems these uncultivated rabble have abducted mothers and daughters to sell in China.
Too bad!
Complain to Japan.
Sponsor a local milita.
Provide sums for reconstruction.

Peace be with you [Root.GetTitledFirstName], Overlord of the Isles in the Korean Sea. I was witness to a pirate attack by men from your harbours. I demand compensation for these attacks, as only fair.
Pay them.
Refuse.
Explain Diplomaticaly.
Dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName], I [From.GetTitledFirstName], regret of these incidents and wish to put this incident behind us. Korean trade is very welcome to Japan.
OK.
Dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName], from the lands of the rising calm. We have nothing to do with the attacks. Let us speak nothing more of this incident.
OK.

Dear [Root.GetTitledFirstName], from the peninsula near the Sea of Japan, it pains the Chrysanthemum Throne to recall the mistaken character of Wa. These pirates are neither from our people or yours, they live on the edge of society and as you are now privy to my missive, nothing can be done.
OK.
A battle ensues that you view with satisfaction. You've lost some men but they have been slain to the last. It is a pity the village is half charred.
Victory!
Sponsor a local milita.
Provide sums for reconstruction.
Watching from the safety of a hill, you sweat as your escort are ambushed at various points: behind houses, the pier, some even drowned.
Er ... lets go!
Your men ride down and drive the criminal to the waters. In their panic they are slain by arrow or sword as the waves flow crimson. Trotting through the ruins you decide this village's fate.
Hold a celebration.
Sponsor a local milita.
Provide sums for reconstruction.
Your men ride down and the pirates hide in the dwellings. Each room is a battle, the pirates fail to understand taking hostages is futile.
Let the pirates leave.
Fire arrows.
Continue the battle.
The village lies almost ruined.
Let us leave.
The fighting continues for some time, you have made a grim statement of will. There are far much less lives in the village, but nothing like a pirate remains.
Hold a celebration.
Sponsor a local milita.
Provide sums for reconstruction.
Adopt an orphan.
During the fray you find your guard occupied and find yourself blade to blade with a pirate.
Fight.
Flee.
Your swing chops off his arm and he begs for mercy.
Granted.
I'll make it short.
Your expert swordsplay holds him at bay until [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] creeps from behind and stabs him through his humours.
Haha!
I owe you.
In the fight you slay the filth but you have been cut badly on the cheek.
Bastards
In the combat you have been wounded. Fortunately your guard came to your rescue
Bastards
Unfortunately during the fight, you had the scum right against the wall when everything went black.
My head hurts
The court has viewed the abandonment of [FromFrom.Location.GetName] as an act of cowardness.
Nobody thinks about me.
You awake in your tent. You groan and see the [Root.job_marshal.GetTitle] send a message outside. Minutes later you hear cheering and conclude you have been victorious.
My head hurts

Because of the ferocity of your attack most of the village remains intact. When you offer to help, the villagers look startled. "What could we ask for after you have saved us?" You declare the proceedings of the pirate ships, rich in Japanese and Ryukyuan goods, has made its last port of call.
Arrows and stones
When you arrive to [fishingvillage.GetName] you are suprised at how run down the village is. The proceedings were lively enough, however.
This is no good.
I'm only here for celebration.
You have decided to promote [fishingvillage.GetName] as a seaport.
Sponsor a new pier.
Exempt the village from taxes.
Force sea trade to go through [fishingvillage.GetName].
Rumblings in your court say your pet project of [fishingvillage.GetName] is eating your valuable time. You have found a poem nailed to your door entitled, "A big tulip doesn't need manure".
Attempt to ignore them.
Delegate to your steward.
Maybe they are right.
How do I look?, asks your [Root.GetHusbandWifeOpp]. But all you can do is notice the pattern of the fishnet in her hair is remarkably innovative.
Er ... great!.
Radient.
Could I perhaps borrow that?
Putrid
After a few days of modification, you have improved the base design of fishing nets. You've decided to name them after [From.GetTitleName]
Inspired by nature.
In your eagerness to increase anchorage you've spoken with [Root.job_steward.GetTitledFirstName] who suggests you reduce army stipends in favour of naval investment. This could last ten years.
How wise!
No thanks.
You have convinced the [From.GetTitleName] to reduce spending on his army in favour of fleet business. Although this clearly is the right move, you and your pockets gain.
I hope [tricked_marshal.GetFirstName] isn't angered.
I am cunning in 1000 ways.

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has convinced our ruler to lower spending on the glorious army, in favour of some soggy wood. Sometimes the self-interest in the [FromFrom.PrimaryTitle.GetFullBaseName] sickens you.
We are rivals.
Let it pass.
Have a drink.

That [GetFromRootInsult] [From.GetBestName], has taken affection to a fishing village, yet in this case the doting parent's purse is plundered. Fortunes are being wasted by forcing trade into disharmony.
Write a letter.
I will hold my tongue.

The [GetRootFromCompliment] [From.GetBestName], has been infactuated with the fishing village of [FromFrom.Location.GetName]. If only the [From.GetTitle] knew that trade, like nature, can only be harmed by the mortal touch.
Write a letter.
I will hold my tongue.
[From.GetBestName] has agreed with your suggestions. You are viewed as the last word in statesmanship for your role in this episode.
Of course!
The [From.GetBestName] has sent your scroll back, which took twelve hours to footnote, with a short message. "A big tulip doesn't need manure"
Well I never!

The [GetRootFromCompliment] [From.GetBestName] has sent a missive that, although you can't be sure all your suggestions will be followed, will lead to positive results. You are sure because [GetRootFromCompliment] [From.GetBestName] has heard your message.
Quite a character!
Lets exchange mail more frequently.
Dear [Root.GetBestName], please don't question my academic acumen. I only keep the most illuminating scholars at my court, best believe that any minute detail I haven't considered, they indeed have.
I hope this stays quiet!

Although [From.GetBestName] and I began our discussions as critic and defendant, we have somehow managed to become dear friends. The spirit of objectivity has broken into trust and we discuss all matters that two scholars could find note-worthy.
Quite a character!
But I've never met [From.GetSheHe].

[From.GetTitledFirstName] has sent a long scroll, the size of a catfish, explaining, some new theory, that giving [fishingvillage.GetName] special privileges somehow increases piracy and hurts the realm.
I'll call it off then.
Yet another doubter.
Write a tactful missive.
Don't challenge my knowledge!.
Piracy has hit in a confounding manner, many foreign vessels, identical to the traders of yesteryear have preyed on everything from villages to local fishing boats.
Rats.
Let's reopen trade.
Smuggling has hit to a disturbing degree, countrymen and foreigners working in rival ports [fishingvillage.GetName]'s primary status illegally.
Criminals.
Let's reopen trade.
Due to improved dockworks, vessels can replace rigging, softwood and sails with no extended stay. Trade is brisk and money flows.
Increase tariffs.
Let the .

While at first [From.GetBestName] was not an enthusiast, of late you can see [From.GetHerHimOpp] greeting captains and sharing tea with dock workers. A inn started by a sailor has even been named [From.GetTitle]]'s Kettle.
OK.
Your harbour looks as desolute as the misfounded capital of Michuhol. You see dogs looking thinner than watered down soup. There are some goods, but you wouldn't call them good.
On to the next project.
Your harbour exists as a fishing village. People will live here and perhaps immigrate to better regions, unless they get married in these parts.
On to the next project.

Your "Port" is five parts fishing village, two parts over-invested traders. In disguise you pass a fruit seller desperately trying to rid herself of her wares. You can see this village existing in the next hundred years, thousand years, like a sea-fowl riding the morning tide.
On to the next project.

Your new port is a player in asia, like a drunken Go player. You notice a self-confidence as farmers try their hand at selling produce to foreigners. Enterprising young men become dockworkers or pickpockets, you notice no less than twenty professions and smile.
What a worthy place.

What a transformation ten years makes! What was an ancient fishing village, is now a modern city with docks, slaves, sacks of wine, crushed pearls and running children. The ladies wear geudam, the men wear the latest Chinese garb. The street is in Han style, although everyone has two houses in Gogureyo fashion. To be from [fishingvillage.GetName] is to be subject of the Great Ocean. It thanks to you foreign map makers will have to apply fresh ink and write [fishingvillage.GetName].
Fantastic.
Dano is over. The best of the year has been celebrated and thanks to your efforts life is springing everywhere. You put thought in what went right or wrong to make next time a greater success.
Just doing our duty.
The Bell of Bulgooka

The lifework of Gyeongdeok of Silla has been finally crafted and Bulgooksa is complete! This bell, smelted by the finest Gaya craftmen, has a unique sound when hit that resonates through the heavenly gardens. It could warn Bulgooksa of any trouble or chase away any harmful spirit for years to come. Truely the greatest temple in Korea.
Blessings to the Budda.
An united history.

Now we exist in an unified state, scholars can stop their overstated claims and write our country's history. This task has been the lifework of [sakgugsagi_target.GetName] who has completed "The History of the Three Realms". His research has taken him from Kaya to Balhae, Baekje to Silla, but [From.GetHerHis] last decision is to present the final draft for the nobles to read.
It reads well.
Villify Silla!
It isn't entertaining enough
Dangun lived for 1500 years?!
We need to pray, in order to have plentiful agriculture and plenty of fish. Yongedung is almost upon us. We have to prepare for his short arrival on our shores.
Everything will be perfect.
A Jesa will be held in our hall for Yongedung.
Everyone should be prepared.
Because you have no suitable children you present the rice wine first. You bow twice and return to your place yet again.
You only have a daughter, until today you have never seen a look of hostility towards her face.
Your oldest_child is a little young to do the first ritual so he watches you perform the ceremony as if learning.
Your oldest_child makes a ritual presentation of rice wine. He bows twice and returns to his place.
Your oldest_child and his wife makes a ritual presentation of rice wine. He bows twice and she bows four times returning to their places.
Good.
Your older brother follows, serving as an awkward reminder he was not picked. He presents baekju to Yongedung to be merry.
Your younger brother follows. He presents baekju to Yongedung to be merry.
Your second son brings baekju to Yongedung, said to be his favorite kind.
You have no kin to bring more gifts to Yongedung. It is a sad state of affairs
All right.
is_pretender presents a rare drink from the Mongolia known as Soju..
Everything will be perfect.

An Elder performs Sapsi by sticking a spoon into the rice bowl. A baksu announces to Yongedung that the offers are laid and everyone but the elder leaves the room. After some quiet minutes, punctured by tummies growling we return to the room.
And some drink to wash it down.

The baksu presents Yongedung with some tea, brewed from roast rice. Everyone bows twice and the table is cleared, the baksu collects prayer books from the attendants and casts them into a fire. You all walk enthuiasticly to another room where the feast is laid out according to rank.
For Yongedung!
A sea-lady is diving for treasure. She disappears for two minutes than reappears with a gold cup. The sea is full of free wealth!
I want to try.
I don't know how to swim.
You tell your guards to form a perimeter and you dive in the ocean naked. You wonder how they see anything as you kick under the sea and wave your hands. You feel nothing.
It was just exercise.

You tell your guards to form a perimeter and you dive in the ocean naked. You wonder how they see anything as you kick under the sea and wave your hands. You feel nothing. You return and stub your toe on something sharp. You pull it up and it is a golden brooch from before the Three Kingdoms.
Anyone can do it.

You tell your guards to form a perimeter and you dive in the ocean naked. You wonder how they see anything as you kick under the sea and wave your hands. You feel a hideous feeling in your arms and let out a cry, it is a floating mass of meat and escapes you with a jolt. You feel yourself drowning when you wake up. Your courtier _________ saved your life.
My gratitude is ocean deep.

Salt fills your nose and mouth as you make your way through the waters. You feel the fish make way for the ____ as you prepare to dive. You try but come up short. On surfacing you spot the Sea Lady right next to you. She dips her head and you freeze. After a quiet minute she emerges with a handful of jewels.
Beh.

You speak to her after she cuts herself against a rock. You bandage her left leg and tell her of your admiration for her. She replies she is honoured to have respects paid by such a noble lord. You talk until the sea turns red and pose the question.
Baekju in my tent milady?
Have you purified yourself before the ceremony?
She calls you a local comparision to a dog and hobbles off.
She informs you that if your parts aren't shaped as a grandfather icon she can't mate you. You truthly reply that is definately not the case.
She whispers to you "Don't take it wrong but you are shaped like a Sea Horse, when pregnant." You reach to slap her and she huffs off.
She says she is the third wife of Jung Jon Kim and describes his muscles and biceps in great detail. You decide after a minute you would do better to leave her alone.

She looks into the sunset. "What does it remind you of?", she replies. "My pounding heart." You instantaneously  reply. "To me it reminds me it is my time of month." You open your mouth, then look away.
She says Baekju isn't her favorite drink and she has a house already. You begin to reply but she gets up and slowly walks back to her village.

She nods and you take her hand and walk her back when two of her friends intercept you. "Oh what happened to Sora?" They ask incrediously, you reply she hurt herself on the rocks and they thank your for the help. Her friends insist to help her home and you are abandoned. Sora loudly argues with her friends who giggle in the distance.
She laughs nervously, you then hit her with a piece of driftwood and carry her to a sea cave. You dig for what seems to be hours and bury her head showing. You then put a starfish on her head.
Drats
She nods and you take her hand and walk her back to your tent. You promise to Yongdeung you will purify yourself extra well after you lead the Sea lady to your bed.
